questions.question: What is the primary purpose of ANSYS software?

options.A: To create CAD models from scratch
options.B: To simulate and analyze product behavior before manufacturing

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a benefit of using ANSYS for analysis?

options.B: Increasing time-to-market

questions.question: What is the von Mises stress formula used for in elastic stress analysis?

options.B: Determining equivalent stress based on principal stresses

questions.question: Which ASME standard is referenced for design-by-analysis requirements in the document?

options.B: ASME BPVC VIII-2

questions.question: What is the first step in setting up a static structural analysis in ANSYS Workbench?

options.B: Importing the geometry file
options.C: Configuring units to "Metric (kg, mm, s, °C, mA, N, mV)"

questions.question: What is the purpose of the "Engineering Data" step in ANSYS Static Structural analysis?

options.B: To define material properties for the analysis

questions.question: How do you add a new material that isn't in the default ANSYS library?

options.B: By using the "Add Material" option in Engineering Data

questions.question: Which of these properties must be defined for a linear elastic material in ANSYS?

options.B: Thermal conductivity and specific heat

questions.question: What does the tick mark (✓) indicate in the ANSYS Workbench project schematic?

options.A: The step has been completed successfully
options.B: The step has errors that need fixing

questions.question: Where do you import an existing CAD model for analysis in ANSYS?

options.B: In the "Geometry" step using Design Modeler

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of meshing in ANSYS analysis?

options.B: To discretize the geometry into finite elements for calculation
options.C: To reduce the file size of the model

questions.question: Which of these operations would you use to refine the mesh in specific areas?

options.B: Sizing control

questions.question: When applying boundary conditions in ANSYS, what does a "Fixed Support" constraint do?

options.B: Restricts all degrees of freedom at selected locations
options.C: Adds thermal loads to the model

questions.question: What type of load would you apply to simulate internal pressure in a vessel?

options.B: Pressure

questions.question: Which solution result would you check to evaluate safety against material yielding?

options.B: Equivalent (von-Mises) stress

questions.question: Which ANSYS result type would you use to evaluate the worst-case stress scenario?

options.B: Equivalent (von-Mises) Stress

questions.question: What does the Safety Factor result of 1.5 indicate about a design?

options.B: The design can withstand 50% more load than applied
options.C: The material is operating at yield point

questions.question: When evaluating deformation results, what should you compare the values against?

options.B: The material's melting point

questions.question: Which tool would you use to analyze repeated loading effects?

options.B: Modal Analysis

questions.question: What does a Fatigue Damage value greater than 1 indicate?

options.B: The part will fail before design life

questions.question: When setting up a fatigue analysis, what does selecting "Fully Reversed" loading imply?

options.A: The load varies between zero and maximum positive value
options.B: The load alternates equally between positive and negative values
options.C: The load remains constant throughout operation

questions.question: Which mean stress theory would be most conservative for ductile materials?

options.B: Gerber

questions.question: If a component shows a fatigue life of 10,000 cycles at a given load, but your design requires 50,000 cycles, what should you do?

options.B: Redesign to reduce stresses or use stronger material
options.C: Change the loading type to "Zero Based"
options.D: Ignore the result if von-Mises stress is acceptable

questions.question: What critical mistake occurs if you run a fatigue analysis without first solving static structural loads?

options.A: ANSYS will automatically approximate missing data
options.B: You'll get no results because fatigue needs stress inputs
options.C: The solution will use default material properties
options.D: Only deformation results will be available

questions.question: When evaluating fatigue safety factor, why is the maximum value capped at 15?

options.B: Beyond 15, results become statistically unreliable
options.C: Components with SF>15 are considered infinite-life designs
